data.title: Praemium Imperiale
data.meta_description: ProfileFrom his debut in the early 1970s, Martin Scorsese has been recognized as one of the most important and influential film-makers of his generati...
data.text:
1942 Born in New York 1967 Who's That Knocking at My Door, first feature film 1973 Mean Streets, first film with Robert De Niro 1974 Directs Italianamerican, a documentary featuring his parents 1976 Taxi Driver is awarded the Palme dâ€™Or at the Cannes Film Festival 1978 Directs The Last Waltz, the final concert performance of The Band 1981 Raging Bull (1980) receives eight Academy Award nominations. Wins two. 1983 The King of Comedy (featuring Jerry Lewis) is released 1986 After Hours wins Best Director award at the Cannes Film Festival 1988 Release of The Last Temptation of Christ 1990 Goodfellas awarded Best Director at the Venice Film Festival

Establishes The Film Foundation, devoted to film preservation 1994 The Age of Innocence is nominated for five Academy Awards 1997 AFI Life Achievement Award, Kundun is released 1998 Kundun is nominated for four Academy Awards 2003 Gangs of New York is nominated for ten Academy Awards, first film with Leonardo DiCaprio 2004 The Aviator wins five Academy Awards 2005 Legion of Honour in France

No Direction Home: Bob Dylan (documentary) wins Peabody Award 2007 The Departed (2006) wins four Academy Awards including Best Director 2008 Documentary of the Rolling Stones in Concert, Shine a Light 2010 A Letter to Elia (about Director Elia Kazan) wins Peabody Award 2011 Documentary George Harrison: Living in the Material World airs on HBO, wins two Primetime Emmy Awards (2012)
